summary: Hermione ends up locked out of Gryffindor Tower with Harry, Ron, and Neville. As they flee from Filch, her fear becomes more apparent—she is anxious and deeply upset at being part of a rule-breaking incident. She criticizes their recklessness and tries to guide them back, but her voice is increasingly panicked. Despite her complaints, she stays with the group and tries to help them navigate, showing loyalty beneath the anxiety.
logline: Dragged into trouble, Hermione’s panic clashes with her instinct to take charge and fix the situation.
speech_style: Fast, panicked, critical; tone wavers between commanding and distressed
